item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 1, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Advent of Code 2024 (834 points | 320 comments)
2. Procedural knowledge in pretraining drives reasoning in large language models (126 points | 22 comments)
3. The Color of Noise (2014) (23 points | discuss)
4. Francis Crick's "Central Dogma" was misunderstood (29 points | 1 comment)
5. Show HN: Markwhen: Markdown for Timelines (55 points | 1 comment)
6. Heaviside’s Operator Calculus (2007) (35 points | 9 comments)
7. Hiroshi Nagai: Japan's Sun-Drenched Americana (4 points | discuss)
8. Show HN: Vicinity – Fast, Lightweight Nearest Neighbors with Flexible Back Ends (26 points | 2 comments)
9. 1/0 = 0 (2018) (20 points | 24 comments)
10. Cursed Linear Types in Rust (52 points | 5 comments)
11. Review of "Statistics" by Freedman, Pisani, and Purves (2017) (109 points | 16 comments)
12. Infisical (YC W23) Is Hiring Full Stack Engineers in SF and Remotely ( | hide)
13. Mobile 3D Printer Can Print Directly on Your Floor (10 points | 7 comments)
14. Show HN: Open-source private home security camera system (end-to-end encryption) (421 points | 125 comments)
15. Ntfs2btrfs does in-place conversion of NTFS filesystem to the open-source Btrfs (374 points | 144 comments)
16. Jeff Dean responds to EDA industry about AlphaChip (202 points | 126 comments)
17. AMD Disables Zen 4's Loop Buffer (285 points | 119 comments)
18. Kyawthuite is so rare it's only ever been found once (170 points | 59 comments)
19. Handwriting but not typewriting leads to widespread connectivity in brain (102 points | 77 comments)
20. Fine, I'll Play With Skiplists (83 points | 11 comments)
21. DynaSaur: Large Language Agents Beyond Predefined Actions (114 points | 28 comments)
22. Who can claim Aristotle? (54 points | 24 comments)
23. An 83-year-old short story by Borges portends a bleak future for the internet (74 points | 48 comments)
24. WinDepends – A Rewrite of the Dependency Walker (140 points | 24 comments)
25. Geometric line-art of Wacław Szpakowski (2017) (449 points | 48 comments)
26. Safe relational database queries using the Rust type system (262 points | 145 comments)
27. The Slang Shading Language (124 points | 38 comments)
28. Kubernetes on Hetzner: cutting my infra bill by 75% (119 points | 56 comments)
29. The Opposite of Documentation is Superstition (2020) (144 points | 73 comments)
